item.title: Evolution of Modern Man Starting from Anthropoid Ancestor
item.description:
Evolution of Modern Man Starting from Anthropoid Ancestor

Introduction

The journey of human evolution is a fascinating and complex process that began millions of years ago with our anthropoid ancestors. Over time, these ancestors underwent significant biological and behavioral changes, leading to the emergence of modern humans, Homo sapiens. This evolutionary process is characterized by the development of upright posture, increased brain size, tool use, and social complexity.

Key Evolutionary Stages

1. Anthropoid Ancestors

The earliest ancestors of modern humans were anthropoid primates that existed around 60 million years ago. These primates were small, tree-dwelling animals with features such as forward-facing eyes and grasping hands, adapted for an arboreal lifestyle.
